publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2116# Paul Martin: Reviewing Arrangements for Managing Registered Sex Offenders—That the Parliament commends those who took part in the Voice for our Children march on 30 October 2004; recognises that, following the murder of eight-year-old Mark Cummings by registered sex offender, Stuart Leggate, there is a requirement for a root-and-branch review of how registered sex offenders are monitored and managed in the community; believes that the current sentencing policy for dealing with registered child sex offenders is grossly inadequate and requires review, that it is not acceptable that registered sex offenders are able to legally act under an alias identity and that the current housing allocation policies for dealing with registered child sex offenders present a serious risk to local communities; considers that an inquiry should be held into the events leading up to the murder of Mark Cummings, and believes that the Scottish Executive should, as a matter of urgency, bring forward measures that will ensure that the risk to our children posed by registered child sex offenders is radically minimised. Supported by: Shiona Baird*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*
S2M-2116# Reviewing Arrangements for Managing Registered Sex Offenders (lodged on 6 December 2004) Mr David Davidson*, Phil Gallie*, Jackie Baillie*, Pauline McNeill*, Ms Sandra White*
S2M-2116# Reviewing Arrangements for Managing Registered Sex Offenders (lodged on 6 December 2004) Mike Watson*, Cathie Craigie*
S2M-2116# Reviewing Arrangements for Managing Registered Sex Offenders (lodged on 6 December 2004) Trish Godman*, Donald Gorrie*, Mr Duncan McNeil*, Cathy Peattie*
